sub_terms.b: to invalidate (a will) by a court proceeding

2 a.definition: to open (another's real property) by force or without privilege (as consent) for entry often used in the phrase[one whoand enters a dwelling-house of another "W. R. LaFave and A. W. Scott, Jr."]

sub_terms.b: to escape by force from [prison or escapes or flees from justice ""]

2 a.s: prison or escapes or flees from justice "

3.definition: to cause (a strike) to fail and discontinue by means (as force) other than bargainingto escape with forceful effort often used with[prisoners wounded while attempting to out]
